Description: Lower body fragment of Chian pottery chalice. Inside glazed with added white ring and disc on floor, the latter enhanced with four red dots; exterior: saw pattern on cul, with two dilute verticals flanking (lost) handle; two dilute bands on lower wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2212)
